content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I used the "browse_website" command to gather information on current exhibitions at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and saved it to a file named "current_exhibitions_metropolitan_museum_of_art.txt" using the "write_to_file" command. I received a command to delete an agent with a specific key, but it returned an error message. I then used the "list_agents" command and started a new agent named "my_gpt_agent" to generate text in response to the prompt "What is the meaning of life?" My computer created the agent with key 0 and returned a response stating that the meaning of life is subjective and varies from person to person. In response to a message asking about the history of the Eiffel Tower, I sent a message to the agent with key 0.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command message_agent returned: Sure, I'd be happy to tell you about the history of the Eiffel Tower!\n\nThe Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It was named after Gustave Eiffel, the engineer whose company designed and built the tower. The tower was constructed in 1889 as the entrance arch to the 1889 World's Fair, which was held in Paris to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution.\n\nThe tower was initially met with skepticism and criticism from many Parisians, who thought it was an eyesore and would ruin the city's skyline. However, it quickly became a popular attraction and a symbol of France, and it has since become one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world.\n\nThe tower stands at 324 meters (1,063 feet) tall, making it the tallest structure in Paris. It held the title of the tallest man-made structure in the world for 41 years until it was surpassed by the Chrysler Building in New York City in 1930.\n\nToday, the Eiffel Tower remains one of the most visited tourist attractions in the world, with millions of visitors every year. It has also been used for various scientific and cultural purposes, such as radio transmissions, meteorological observations, and as a backdrop for films and television shows."}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "eiffel_tower_history.txt", "text": "The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It was named after Gustave Eiffel, the engineer whose company designed and built the tower. The tower was constructed in 1889 as the entrance arch to the 1889 World\'s Fair, which was held in Paris to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution.\\n\\nThe tower was initially met with skepticism and criticism from many Parisians, who thought it was an eyesore and would ruin the city\'s skyline. However, it quickly became a popular attraction and a symbol of France, and it has since become one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world.\\n\\nThe tower stands at 324 meters (1,063 feet) tall, making it the tallest structure in Paris. It held the title of the tallest man-made structure in the world for 41 years until it was surpassed by the Chrysler Building in New York City in 1930.\\n\\nToday, the Eiffel Tower remains one of the most visited tourist attractions in the world, with millions of visitors every year. It has also been used for various scientific and cultural purposes, such as radio transmissions, meteorological observations, and as a backdrop for films and television shows."}}}'}]
"""
